subject: Gardening
title: Why Flowers Exist
description: Learn Why Flowers Exist in one minute.

hook.text: Flowers didn't always exist. For 300 million years, plants reproduced without a single petal.

buildup.text: Conifers and ferns relied on wind pollinationâ€”scattering pollen blindly and hoping it landed correctly.

discovery.text: Around 130 million years ago, flowering plants evolved to recruit insects as targeted pollen couriers.

twist.text: Flowers are bribery organs. Color, scent, and nectar exist solely to lure animals into carrying pollen.

climax.text: This partnership was so successful that flowering plants now dominate 90% of all plant species on Earth.

punchline.text: Flowers are nature's most successful bribe.

quiz.question: Why did flowers evolve in plants?
options: To protect seeds from harsh weather conditions
To recruit animals as targeted pollen carriers using color, scent, and nectar
To absorb additional sunlight for photosynthesis
